This Veterans Day, Hire Heroes USA invites you to share the stories of the men and women you know that have served in the U.S. armed forces. Our COO Nate Smith shares his thoughts about Hire Heroes USA reaching the milestone of 10,000 hires since we first started assisting transitioning military, veterans and military spouses:  



"I remember joining the team in 2010 when we helped, literally, about 2 veterans per month get jobs. The distance between that rate of success and our current rate, which sometimes approaches 200 clients confirmed hired in a single week, is largely due to three factors. First and most important, we have an exceptionally talented team that believes in our mission and in the economic potential of our nation's military and military families. Second, we have remained narrowly focused on veteran unemployment as the contributing factor to so many other challenges faced by veterans and military families. Third, we have benefitted from remarkably loyal and generous donors and supporters, without whom we would have been nothing but a flash in the pan. The truly exciting part of reaching this milestone is we can now set our sights on 100,000 confirmed hires and know it is completely achievable."
U.S. and British athletes compete in the 100-meter sprint at the 2015 Department of Defense Warrior Games on Marine Corps Base Quantico, Va., June 23, 2015. #ThrowbackThursday

How did we reach that 10,000 Hires milestone? Through the personal efforts of our great Veteran Transition Specialists, like Shana Mays. Truly amazing and inspiring work by our team - we thank each and every one of them!

Former MedAssets Chairman, President and CEO John Bardis is the founder of Hire Heroes USA. He shared his own perspective with us on reaching a milestone #10KHires:  



"We are eternally grateful for the sacrifices of every American service member and every American family of our brave military men and women. It is gratifying to witness the remarkable impact of Hire Heroes USA and our outstanding staff in reaching the 10,000 confirmed hires into productive civilian roles. I am particularly proud of the leadership of Brian Stann and Nate Smith who as combat veterans have led our outstanding organization to achieve this milestone. We believe our citizen soldiers deserve to be in the 'front of the line' for the opportunities and way of life they have served so bravely to preserve."
Our CEO Brian Stann went Live on Periscope today to talk about the impact and importance of Hire Heroes USA reaching the milestone of 10,000 Hires. Click the link to watch the recording. #10KHires

What industries are of interest to military members and veterans when they seek employment in the civilian workforce?

On this day, 70 years ago, during the Battle of Iwo Jima, U.S. Marines took the crest of Mount Suribachi and raised the U.S. flag. Joe Rosenthal captured the six service members on camera, and the photo quickly became one of the most widely-recognized images of World War II. The picture later served as a model for the Marine Corps War Memorial in Arlington, Virginia.

Friends, Supporters and Veterans:



I hope this letter finds you enjoying your holidays this year. The team at Hire Heroes USA has been working overtime to close out the year with a tremendous amount of Veterans and new companies utilizing our services. While we are proud of our weekly average of 4.5 veteran hires, we are striving for much greater output. We will continue to grow this organization strategically to meet the ever-growing demand of our services, as the military continues to downsize and more of our nations heroes look for their next career. 



I hope everyone was able to see the clips of our Chairman, John Bardis, on Fox and Friends this month speaking about Hire Heroes USA. If not, please feel free to view the video now: http://video.foxnews.com/v/1332666291001/hire-heroes-usa/. Hire Heroes USA is quickly becoming the largest veteran employment not for profit in the country. 



We are so grateful to all of you for helping us get to this point. I must personally thank CresaPartners in Atlanta for their recent donation of $50,000. This again displays the dedication of our corporate partners and donors to ensure our service men and women are given every opportunity to succeed.



From all of us at Hire Heroes USA, please have a wonderful holiday.



Semper Fidelis,



Brian Stann



President, Hire Heroes USA

"Officials at the U.S. Labor Department say that unemployment among veterans age 18-24 years old tops 20 percent, compared with the national rate of about nine percent.  And the situation is expected to worsen after 10,000 service members return from Afghanistan and 46,000 come home from Iraq by year's end - many of whom wounded or suffering from mental trauma. A major factor in veteran high unemployment rate is their struggle with fitting in, adjusting to civilian life and a vast majority struggle with depression and other emotional anguish without seeking mental help, given its perceived stigma." - John Bardis, Hire Heroes USA Founder & CEO of MedAssets

Veterans United using No. 32 to help unemployed veterans



Veterans United Home Loans and Hire Heroes USA are teaming up to spotlight the epidemic of veteran unemployment as Veterans United sponsors the No. 32 car driven by Mike Bliss during the Sprint Cup race at Phoenix.



Veterans United, a company that helps veterans use their VA benefits to buy or refinance homes, will showcase the Hire Heroes USA logo on the No. 32 car owned by Frank Stoddard's FAS Lane Racing to raise awareness and support for this impactful organization, which provides transition assistance and job placement services for returning veterans and transitioning military personnel.



"We hope our continued partnership with Hire Heroes USA raises awareness of the significant employment problems facing our returning service members, who have sacrificed so much," said Nathan Long, CEO of Veterans United.

Greetings Hire Heroes Employees!



I just wanted to express my sincere gratitude to you for all the assistance you both provided to me while I was transition from the Air Force into becoming gainfully employed as a civilian. I recently accepted an offer for what I would describe as a ‚Äúdream career‚Äù as a contract specialist with the Department of Veterans Affairs. After I accepted, I spoke with the hiring authorities and they said that it was my resume, prepared by you, that scored very high and landed me the opportunity to interview. I believe that if I hadn‚Äôt received your guidance, my resume wouldn‚Äôt have gotten this sort of attention and I‚Äôd still be answering the phone as a telephone operator. So here‚Äôs a bit of proof that you, and Hire Heroes USA, provide an outstanding and truly needed service to veterans. Thank you!



Thank You Very Much,

Happy Veteran

"There are issues, especially with the young veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan, of being behind their peers in education and civilian employment experience," said Nathan Smith, executive director of the organization Hire Heroes USA. Another Success Story, Hired Veteran, Ms. Christina Allen!



We are thrilled to announce that after reading about Christina in the December 2010 HHUSA Newsletter and realizing her talent, HHUSA Corporate Partner, Tim Smith, President of 411 Eagle Graphics, interviewed and hired Christina as a Customer Service Representative on January 2nd, 2011!



Ms. Christina Allen joined the Marine Corps in 2006 because, as she puts it, she "wanted to be the best of the best!" Currently residing in California, Christina wanted to further her experience in an administrative capacity.

Success Story! Hired Veteran Jon Skipper-

Hire Heroes USA is pleased to announce our partnership with PwC! We would like to sincerely thank PwC for their strong commitment to hiring veterans to fill their Public Sector jobs, located throughout the United States.



Additionally, PwC has generously pledged to help Hire Heroes USA reach our shared goal of drastically decreasing the unemployment rate of the men and women who served this country.







About PwC's commitment to this cause:







PwC is actively helping governments and international alliances around the world understand and respond to increasing complex and unpredictable defence challenges. Governments and alliances, at all levels (international, national, state and local), operate in an environment characterized by increasing economic migration, changing demographics, diminishing natural resources, rising security concerns, financial pressure, and a more demanding electorate. In today's world the mandate to transform from traditional defence capabilities has never been stronger. PwC is well-equipped to facilitate this change.







The focus of their defence offerings is helping defence organizations to become more agile - flexible, accountable, and able to rapidly respond. PwC's network of premier business advisors has strong relationships with defense leaders at the local level while also bringing knowledge of the global security environment and the complexities and dependencies therein. Below are some of the services that are delivered in a collaborative, open and direct style by PwC professionals wherever in the world you need them.

 

‚Ä¢ Operational effectiveness

‚Ä¢ Evaluation & studies

‚Ä¢ Stabilization operations

‚Ä¢ Human capital & change management

‚Ä¢ Risk & governance management

‚Ä¢ Program & project management

‚Ä¢ Finance & assurance services

‚Ä¢ Information technology services

Hire Heroes USA would like to extend a heartfelt thank you to the National Coalition of Associations of 7-Eleven Franchisees.  During the annual conference held July 22-25, 2010 at the Gaylord National Resort and Spa, the Association hosted a golf tournament at Andrews Air Force Base.  Hire Heroes USA was chosen as the associations beneficiary for the event.  With the dedication and support of the men and women attending the conference, the NCA SEF raised $100,000 for Hire Heroes USA.  Hire Heroes USA would once again like to say thank you for the generous contributions to our program.
